snippet: Though surrounded by computer terminals, many office workers still have practical reasons for using pen and paper in their daily tasks.
abstract: Phyllis Korkki Workstation column contends that many office workers, though surrounded by computer terminals, still have practical reasons for using pen and paper in their daily tasks; posits reading and writing on paper serves a function that a screen cannot replicate.
lead_paragraph: Though surrounded by computer terminals, many office workers still have practical reasons for using pen and paper in their daily tasks.

headline.print_headline: In Defense Of the Power Of Paper
headline.seo: Pen and Paper, Still Practical in the Office - Workstation
headline.main: In Defense of the Power of Paper
